SectionBody.Text: A support order or an income-withholding order issued by a tribunal of another state may be registered in this state for enforcement.

Note.Text: Section 81, ch. 2011-92, provides that “[e]xcept as otherwise expressly provided in this act, this act shall take effect upon the earlier of 90 days following Congress amending 42 U.S.C. s. 666(f) to allow or require states to adopt the 2008 version of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, or 90 days following the state obtaining a waiver of its state plan requirement under Title IV-D of the Social Security Act.” Section 44, ch. 2011-92, amended s. 88.6011, to read:
88.6011 Registration of order for enforcement.A support order or an income-withholding order issued in another state or a foreign support order may be registered in this state for enforcement.
